newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: RESEARCH ALERT-Noel rated market perform.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Noel rated market perform.

text.p: Sanatander Investment said it had initiated coverage of Noel, Colombia's largest processed food company in terms of sales, with a market perform rating.
"After rallying 67 percent in U.S. dollar terms in the year to date, the shares have little additional upside remaining, in our view," Santander said in a statement.
It added that its 12-month target price for the company's stock was $5.68, slightly above Santander's outlook for Medellin's IBOMED .IBMG general price index.
"We estimate that Noel's operating profit will rise by 18 percent and 39 percent in U.S. dollar terms in 1997 and 1998, respectively," Santander said.
"However, weak consumer demand, increasing competition and the growing negotiating power of Colombia's retailers mean that top-line growth in 1997 should be lackluster," it said.

It sees a combination of share dilution and high interest expenses leading to a nine percent drop in earnings per share in U.S. dollar terms this year, but it said this should turn around in 1998, when earnings per share should grow 27 percent.
